variant.question: A DME ground station can generally respond to a maximum of 100 aircraft at once. What is the reason for this limitation?

options.text: Saturation of the DME ground station working on only one receive frequency and one transmit frequency.
Saturation of the DME receivers in the aircraft, receiving all interrogations of other aircraft in the vicinity that are on the same frequency.
The difference in strengths of the received signals CANNOT be differentiated by the DME ground station, and consequently the weakest signals fall off.
Limitation of transmission by the echo protection circuit, which avoids replies being reflected and coming back into the DME ground station.

variant.question: A DME ground station is used by more than 100 aircraft. Which aircraft it will respond to depends on...

options.text: ...the transmitter power of the aircraft and its range from the DME.
...the type of aircraft operation, with IFR approaches having the highest priority.
...how long each aircraft has been searching for a lock-on, with the one waiting longest having the highest priority.
...the range of the aircraft from the DME, and how long it has been searching for a lock-on.

variant.question: Why can DME stations only send out distance information to approximately 100 aircraft at a time?

options.text: A DME ground station is only able to process 2 700 ppps.
A DME ground station can only monitor 100 aircraft at a time.
Aircraft are sending out 12 ppps and a DME station is only able to process around 1 200 ppps.
A DME ground station is only able to process 100 ppps.

variant.question: Why is a conventional DME limited to providing distance information to around 100 aircaft at any given time?

options.text: The DME transmission and reception is limited to 2,700 pulses per second
The transmission is limited by the curvature of the earth
The transmission power is limited/reduced so that only 100 aircraft can receive it
The DME ground station can only monitor 100 aircraft

variant.question: Which statement about the interrogation by the DME-interrogator is correct?

options.text: The interrogation does not start before pulse-pairs of the tuned DME-station are received.
The interrogation starts when the interrogator has been warmed up sufficiently, whether pulse-pairs are received or not.
The interrogation can only take place if the Echo Protection Circuit has been locked.
The interrogation starts directly after the correct DME-frequency has been selected on the frequency-selecting-panel by the pilot.
